frameDefinitions: A Wearer wears accessories, which are made of  some Material and may have a Style.
This frame concerns the movement of a Theme and an Agent and/or Carrier.
The Payer is (legally) forced to pay a Fine by an official Speaker as a punishment for some action (the Reason).
A Supply of a Resource is kept safe and available for a future Use.
This frame covers entities which are prototypically conceived of and created to fulfill the function of containing--i.e.
This frame covers words for Body_part(s) (BP) belonging to a Possessor (Poss), which may be characterized by a Descriptor (Desc).
frameExamples: She wore a black velvet <t>hat</t> on her head.
Karl <t>carried</t> the books across campus to the library on his head.
They were <t>fined</t> approximately $3.1 billion dollars for their knowing, malicious injury to consumers.
Our <t>supply</t> of food is running low.
He had to brace his right <t><fex name='Body_part'>arm</fex></t> against his leg in order to fight the roll.
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies  the <fen>Accoutrement</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is a sentient being who physically controls the movement of the <fen>Theme</fen> via the carrier, accompanying the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<fen>Goal</fen> identifies the endpoint of the path.
<fen>Source</fen> indicates the beginning of the path along which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels.
Path along which carrying occurs.
The objects being carried.
<fen>Area</fen> is used for descriprion of a general area in which the carrying action takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path.
The <fen>Carrier</fen> provides support for the <fen>Theme</fen>.  Movement of the <fen>Carrier</fen> results in movement of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The time in which the carrying event takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the general area that serves as a setting for the specific motion of the <fen>Agent</fen> and <fen>Theme</fen> (with <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, or <fen>Goal</fen>).
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person who imposes the <fen>Fine</fen> upon the <fen>Payer</fen>.
The <fen>Payer</fen> is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment is made.  With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object:

Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <t>Reason</t> for the Judge's judgment. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP, e.g. I <t>admire</t> you <fex name='Reason'>for your intellect</fex>. For some words in this domain, the Reason frame element is obligatory. That is to say, the overt expression of this frame element may only be omitted when the reason for the judgment is understood from context. For example, the sentence 'I <t>blame</t> you!' can only be uttered when it is clear what the addressee is being blamed for.
The money given to expiate some debt for transgression.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
This role denotes the <fen>Supply</fen> of <fen>Resource</fen>s. It is incorporated into each LU in this frame.
The goods or commodity that is being stored in a <fen>Supply</fen>.
The future <fen>Use</fen> for the <fen>Resource</fen>.
The entity that possesses the <fen>Supply</fen>.
<fen>Container</fen> is an object which is conventionally used as a container.  Target words in this frame are tagged with this frame element.
This Frame Element denotes the <fen>Possessor</fen> of the <fen>Body_part</fen>.
This Frame Element  is the <fen>Body_part</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Karl</fex> carried the books across the campus to the library.
Karl carried the books <fex>to the library</fex>.
Karl hauled the books <fex>from the library</fex>  to the office.
Karl carried the books <fex>across the campus</fex>.
Karl toted <fex>the books</fex> to the car.
<fex>The boat</fex> ferried the troops across the river.
<fex>Even in such a small port</fex>, these boats would transport many tons of trade-goods in to shore annually.
The mental control officer fined <fex>you</fex> for your lack of diligence.
India has made great strides in agriculture and now not only meets it own grain needs but has a sizeable reserve <fex>of basic grains, mainly rice and wheat</fex>.
Due to restrictions imposed by our export control, the Japanese have begun to use a portion of their <fex>war</fex> reserve of petroleum.
In 1997, <fex>France's</fex> stock of unirradiated civil plutonium increased to 72 tons.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Camino Real or King's Highway
